channel.title: Minimal Blog - @lekoarts/gatsby-theme-minimal-blog
channel.description: Typography driven, feature-rich blogging theme with minimal aesthetics. Includes tags/categories support and extensive features for code blocks such as live preview, line numbers, and line highlighting.

item.title: tutorial_taskflow_api_etl
item.content:encoded:
tutorial_taskflow_api_etl

1#
2# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
3# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
4# distributed with this work for additional information
5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
6# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
7# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
8# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
9#
10#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
11#
12# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19# pylint: disable=missing-function-docstring
20

21# [START tutorial]
22# [START import_module]
23import json
24

25from airflow.decorators import dag, task
26from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
27

28# [END import_module]
29

30# [START default_args]
31# These args will get passed on to each operator
32# You can override them on a per-task basis during operator initialization
33default_args = {
34    'owner': 'airflow',
35}
36# [END default_args]
37

38

39# [START instantiate_dag]
40@dag(default_args=default_args, schedule_interval=None, start_date=days_ago(2), tags=['example'])
41def tutorial_taskflow_api_etl():
42    """
43    ### TaskFlow API Tutorial Documentation
44    This is a simple ETL data pipeline example which demonstrates the use of
45    the TaskFlow API using three simple tasks for Extract, Transform, and Load.
46    Documentation that goes along with the Airflow TaskFlow API tutorial is
47    located
48    [here](https://airflow.apache.org/docs/stable/tutorial_taskflow_api.html)
49    """
50    # [END instantiate_dag]
51

52    # [START extract]
53    @task()
54    def extract():
55        """
56        #### Extract task
57        A simple Extract task to get data ready for the rest of the data
58        pipeline. In this case, getting data is simulated by reading from a
59        hardcoded JSON string.
60        """
61        data_string = '{"1001": 301.27, "1002": 433.21, "1003": 502.22}'
62

63        order_data_dict = json.loads(data_string)
64        return order_data_dict
65

66    # [END extract]
67

68    # [START transform]
69    @task(multiple_outputs=True)
70    def transform(order_data_dict: dict):
71        """
72        #### Transform task
73        A simple Transform task which takes in the collection of order data and
74        computes the total order value.
75        """
76        total_order_value = 0
77

78        for value in order_data_dict.values():
79            total_order_value += value
80

81        return {"total_order_value": total_order_value}
82

83    # [END transform]
84

85    # [START load]
86    @task()
87    def load(total_order_value: float):
88        """
89        #### Load task
90        A simple Load task which takes in the result of the Transform task and
91        instead of saving it to end user review, just prints it out.
92        """
93

94        print("Total order value is: %.2f" % total_order_value)
95

96    # [END load]
97

98    # [START main_flow]
99    order_data = extract()
100    order_summary = transform(order_data)
101    load(order_summary["total_order_value"])
102    # [END main_flow]
103

104

105# [START dag_invocation]
106tutorial_etl_dag = tutorial_taskflow_api_etl()
107# [END dag_invocation]
108

109# [END tutorial]

item.content:encoded:
tutorial

1#
2# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
3# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file

5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
6# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the

13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""
20### Tutorial Documentation
21Documentation that goes along with the Airflow tutorial located
22[here](https://airflow.apache.org/tutorial.html)
23"""
24# [START tutorial]
25# [START import_module]
26from datetime import timedelta
27

28# The DAG object; we'll need this to instantiate a DAG
29from airflow import DAG
30

31# Operators; we need this to operate!
32from airflow.operators.bash import BashOperator
33from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
34

35# [END import_module]
36

37# [START default_args]
38# These args will get passed on to each operator
39# You can override them on a per-task basis during operator initialization
40default_args = {
41    'owner': 'airflow',
42    'depends_on_past': False,
43    'email': ['airflow@example.com'],
44    'email_on_failure': False,
45    'email_on_retry': False,
46    'retries': 1,
47    'retry_delay': timedelta(minutes=5),
48    # 'queue': 'bash_queue',
49    # 'pool': 'backfill',
50    # 'priority_weight': 10,
51    # 'end_date': datetime(2016, 1, 1),
52    # 'wait_for_downstream': False,
53    # 'dag': dag,
54    # 'sla': timedelta(hours=2),
55    # 'execution_timeout': timedelta(seconds=300),
56    # 'on_failure_callback': some_function,
57    # 'on_success_callback': some_other_function,
58    # 'on_retry_callback': another_function,
59    # 'sla_miss_callback': yet_another_function,
60    # 'trigger_rule': 'all_success'
61}
62# [END default_args]
63

64# [START instantiate_dag]
65dag = DAG(
66    'tutorial',
67    default_args=default_args,
68    description='A simple tutorial DAG',
69    schedule_interval=timedelta(days=1),
70    start_date=days_ago(2),
71    tags=['example'],
72)
73# [END instantiate_dag]
74

75# t1, t2 and t3 are examples of tasks created by instantiating operators
76# [START basic_task]
77t1 = BashOperator(
78    task_id='print_date',
79    bash_command='date',
80    dag=dag,
81)
82

83t2 = BashOperator(
84    task_id='sleep',
85    depends_on_past=False,
86    bash_command='sleep 5',
87    retries=3,
88    dag=dag,
89)
90# [END basic_task]
91

92# [START documentation]
93dag.doc_md = __doc__
94

95t1.doc_md = """\
96#### Task Documentation
97You can document your task using the attributes `doc_md` (markdown),
98`doc` (plain text), `doc_rst`, `doc_json`, `doc_yaml` which gets
99rendered in the UI's Task Instance Details page.
100![img](http://montcs.bloomu.edu/~bobmon/Semesters/2012-01/491/import%20soul.png)
101"""
102# [END documentation]
103

104# [START jinja_template]
105templated_command = """
106{% for i in range(5) %}
107    echo "{{ ds }}"
108    echo "{{ macros.ds_add(ds, 7)}}"
109    echo "{{ params.my_param }}"
110{% endfor %}
111"""
112

113t3 = BashOperator(
114    task_id='templated',
115    depends_on_past=False,
116    bash_command=templated_command,
117    params={'my_param': 'Parameter I passed in'},
118    dag=dag,
119)
120# [END jinja_template]
121

122t1 >> [t2, t3]
123# [END tutorial]

18"""
19Example LatestOnlyOperator and TriggerRule interactions
20"""
21

22# [START example]
23import datetime as dt
24

25from airflow import DAG
26from airflow.operators.dummy import DummyOperator
27from airflow.operators.latest_only import LatestOnlyOperator
28from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
29from airflow.utils.trigger_rule import TriggerRule
30

31dag = DAG(
32    dag_id='latest_only_with_trigger',
33    schedule_interval=dt.timedelta(hours=4),
34    start_date=days_ago(2),
35    tags=['example3'],
36)
37

38latest_only = LatestOnlyOperator(task_id='latest_only', dag=dag)
39task1 = DummyOperator(task_id='task1', dag=dag)
40task2 = DummyOperator(task_id='task2', dag=dag)
41task3 = DummyOperator(task_id='task3', dag=dag)
42task4 = DummyOperator(task_id='task4', dag=dag, trigger_rule=TriggerRule.ALL_DONE)
43

44latest_only >> task1 >> [task3, task4]
45task2 >> [task3, task4]
46# [END example]

item.title: tutorial_etl_dag
item.content:encoded:
tutorial_etl_dag

1#
2# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
3# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
4# distributed with this work for additional information
5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
6# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
7# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
8# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
9#
10#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
11#
12# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19# pylint: disable=missing-function-docstring
20

21"""
22### ETL DAG Tutorial Documentation
23This ETL DAG is compatible with Airflow 1.10.x (specifically tested with 1.10.12) and is referenced
24as part of the documentation that goes along with the Airflow Functional DAG tutorial located
25[here](https://airflow.apache.org/tutorial_decorated_flows.html)
26"""
27# [START tutorial]
28# [START import_module]
29import json
30

31# The DAG object; we'll need this to instantiate a DAG
32from airflow import DAG
33

34# Operators; we need this to operate!
35from airflow.operators.python import PythonOperator
36from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
37

38# [END import_module]
39

40# [START default_args]
41# These args will get passed on to each operator
42# You can override them on a per-task basis during operator initialization
43default_args = {
44    'owner': 'airflow',
45}
46# [END default_args]
47

48# [START instantiate_dag]
49with DAG(
50    'tutorial_etl_dag',
51    default_args=default_args,
52    description='ETL DAG tutorial',
53    schedule_interval=None,
54    start_date=days_ago(2),
55    tags=['example'],
56) as dag:
57    # [END instantiate_dag]
58    # [START documentation]
59    dag.doc_md = __doc__
60    # [END documentation]
61

62    # [START extract_function]
63    def extract(**kwargs):
64        ti = kwargs['ti']
65        data_string = '{"1001": 301.27, "1002": 433.21, "1003": 502.22}'
66        ti.xcom_push('order_data', data_string)
67

68    # [END extract_function]
69

70    # [START transform_function]
71    def transform(**kwargs):
72        ti = kwargs['ti']
73        extract_data_string = ti.xcom_pull(task_ids='extract', key='order_data')
74        order_data = json.loads(extract_data_string)
75

76        total_order_value = 0
77        for value in order_data.values():
78            total_order_value += value
79

80        total_value = {"total_order_value": total_order_value}
81        total_value_json_string = json.dumps(total_value)
82        ti.xcom_push('total_order_value', total_value_json_string)
83

84    # [END transform_function]
85

86    # [START load_function]
87    def load(**kwargs):
88        ti = kwargs['ti']
89        total_value_string = ti.xcom_pull(task_ids='transform', key='total_order_value')
90        total_order_value = json.loads(total_value_string)
91

92        print(total_order_value)
93

94    # [END load_function]
95

96    # [START main_flow]
97    extract_task = PythonOperator(
98        task_id='extract',
99        python_callable=extract,
100    )
101    extract_task.doc_md = """\
102#### Extract task
103A simple Extract task to get data ready for the rest of the data pipeline.
104In this case, getting data is simulated by reading from a hardcoded JSON string.
105This data is then put into xcom, so that it can be processed by the next task.
106"""
107

108    transform_task = PythonOperator(
109        task_id='transform',
110        python_callable=transform,
111    )
112    transform_task.doc_md = """\
113#### Transform task
114A simple Transform task which takes in the collection of order data from xcom
115and computes the total order value.
116This computed value is then put into xcom, so that it can be processed by the next task.
117"""
118

119    load_task = PythonOperator(
120        task_id='load',
121        python_callable=load,
122    )
123    load_task.doc_md = """\
124#### Load task
125A simple Load task which takes in the result of the Transform task, by reading it
126from xcom and instead of saving it to end user review, just prints it out.
127"""
128

129    extract_task >> transform_task >> load_task
130

131# [END main_flow]
132

133# [END tutorial]

item.title: example_xcom_args_with_operators

example_xcom_args_with_operators

17# under the License.
18

19"""Example DAG demonstrating the usage of the XComArgs."""
20import logging
21

22from airflow import DAG
23from airflow.operators.bash import BashOperator
24from airflow.operators.python import PythonOperator, get_current_context, task
25from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
26

27log = logging.getLogger(__name__)
28

29

30def generate_value():
31    """Dummy function"""
32    return "Bring me a shrubbery!"
33

34

35@task()
36def print_value(value):
37    """Dummy function"""
38    ctx = get_current_context()
39    log.info("The knights of Ni say: %s (at %s)", value, ctx['ts'])
40

41

42with DAG(
43    dag_id='example_xcom_args',
44    default_args={'owner': 'airflow'},
45    start_date=days_ago(2),
46    schedule_interval=None,
47    tags=['example'],
48) as dag:
49    task1 = PythonOperator(
50        task_id='generate_value',
51        python_callable=generate_value,
52    )
53

54    print_value(task1.output)
55

56

57with DAG(
58    "example_xcom_args_with_operators",
59    default_args={'owner': 'airflow'},
60    start_date=days_ago(2),
61    schedule_interval=None,
62    tags=['example'],
63) as dag2:
64    bash_op1 = BashOperator(task_id="c", bash_command="echo c")
65    bash_op2 = BashOperator(task_id="d", bash_command="echo c")
66    xcom_args_a = print_value("first!")
67    xcom_args_b = print_value("second!")
68

69    bash_op1 >> xcom_args_a >> xcom_args_b >> bash_op2

item.title: example_xcom
item.content:encoded:
example_xcom

1#
2# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
3# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
4# distributed with this work for additional information
5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
6# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
7# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
8# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
9#
10#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
11#
12# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""Example DAG demonstrating the usage of XComs."""
20from airflow import DAG
21from airflow.operators.python import PythonOperator
22from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
23

24dag = DAG(
25    'example_xcom',
26    schedule_interval="@once",
27    start_date=days_ago(2),
28    default_args={'owner': 'airflow'},
29    tags=['example'],
30)
31

32value_1 = [1, 2, 3]
33value_2 = {'a': 'b'}
34

35

36def push(**kwargs):
37    """Pushes an XCom without a specific target"""
38    kwargs['ti'].xcom_push(key='value from pusher 1', value=value_1)
39

40

41def push_by_returning(**kwargs):
42    """Pushes an XCom without a specific target, just by returning it"""
43    return value_2
44

45

46def puller(**kwargs):
47    """Pull all previously pushed XComs and check if the pushed values match the pulled values."""
48    ti = kwargs['ti']
49

50    # get value_1
51    pulled_value_1 = ti.xcom_pull(key=None, task_ids='push')
52    if pulled_value_1 != value_1:
53        raise ValueError(f'The two values differ {pulled_value_1} and {value_1}')
54

55    # get value_2
56    pulled_value_2 = ti.xcom_pull(task_ids='push_by_returning')
57    if pulled_value_2 != value_2:
58        raise ValueError(f'The two values differ {pulled_value_2} and {value_2}')
59

60    # get both value_1 and value_2
61    pulled_value_1, pulled_value_2 = ti.xcom_pull(key=None, task_ids=['push', 'push_by_returning'])
62    if pulled_value_1 != value_1:
63        raise ValueError(f'The two values differ {pulled_value_1} and {value_1}')
64    if pulled_value_2 != value_2:
65        raise ValueError(f'The two values differ {pulled_value_2} and {value_2}')
66

67

68push1 = PythonOperator(
69    task_id='push',
70    dag=dag,
71    python_callable=push,
72)
73

74push2 = PythonOperator(
75    task_id='push_by_returning',
76    dag=dag,
77    python_callable=push_by_returning,
78)
79

80pull = PythonOperator(
81    task_id='puller',
82    dag=dag,
83    python_callable=puller,
84)
85

86pull << [push1, push2]

19"""
20Example usage of the TriggerDagRunOperator. This example holds 2 DAGs:
211. 1st DAG (example_trigger_controller_dag) holds a TriggerDagRunOperator, which will trigger the 2nd DAG
222. 2nd DAG (example_trigger_target_dag) which will be triggered by the TriggerDagRunOperator in the 1st DAG
23"""
24

25from airflow import DAG
26from airflow.operators.bash import BashOperator
27from airflow.operators.python import PythonOperator
28from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
29

30dag = DAG(
31    dag_id="example_trigger_target_dag",
32    default_args={"owner": "airflow"},
33    start_date=days_ago(2),
34    schedule_interval=None,
35    tags=['example'],
36)
37

38

39def run_this_func(**context):
40    """
41    Print the payload "message" passed to the DagRun conf attribute.
42

43    :param context: The execution context
44    :type context: dict
45    """
46    print("Remotely received value of {} for key=message".format(context["dag_run"].conf["message"]))
47

48

49run_this = PythonOperator(task_id="run_this", python_callable=run_this_func, dag=dag)
50

51bash_task = BashOperator(
52    task_id="bash_task",
53    bash_command='echo "Here is the message: $message"',
54    env={'message': '{{ dag_run.conf["message"] if dag_run else "" }}'},
55    dag=dag,
56)

example_task_group

19"""Example DAG demonstrating the usage of the TaskGroup."""
20

21from airflow.models.dag import DAG
22from airflow.operators.bash import BashOperator
23from airflow.operators.dummy import DummyOperator
24from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
25from airflow.utils.task_group import TaskGroup
26

27# [START howto_task_group]
28with DAG(dag_id="example_task_group", start_date=days_ago(2), tags=["example"]) as dag:
29    start = DummyOperator(task_id="start")
30

31    # [START howto_task_group_section_1]
32    with TaskGroup("section_1", tooltip="Tasks for section_1") as section_1:
33        task_1 = DummyOperator(task_id="task_1")
34        task_2 = BashOperator(task_id="task_2", bash_command='echo 1')
35        task_3 = DummyOperator(task_id="task_3")
36

37        task_1 >> [task_2, task_3]
38    # [END howto_task_group_section_1]
39

40    # [START howto_task_group_section_2]
41    with TaskGroup("section_2", tooltip="Tasks for section_2") as section_2:
42        task_1 = DummyOperator(task_id="task_1")
43

44        # [START howto_task_group_inner_section_2]
45        with TaskGroup("inner_section_2", tooltip="Tasks for inner_section2") as inner_section_2:
46            task_2 = BashOperator(task_id="task_2", bash_command='echo 1')
47            task_3 = DummyOperator(task_id="task_3")
48            task_4 = DummyOperator(task_id="task_4")
49

50            [task_2, task_3] >> task_4
51        # [END howto_task_group_inner_section_2]
52

53    # [END howto_task_group_section_2]
54

55    end = DummyOperator(task_id='end')
56

57    start >> section_1 >> section_2 >> end
58# [END howto_task_group]

item.content:encoded:
example_skip_dag

16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""Example DAG demonstrating the DummyOperator and a custom DummySkipOperator which skips by default."""
20

21from airflow import DAG
22from airflow.exceptions import AirflowSkipException
23from airflow.operators.dummy import DummyOperator
24from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
25

26args = {
27    'owner': 'airflow',
28}
29

30

31# Create some placeholder operators
32class DummySkipOperator(DummyOperator):
33    """Dummy operator which always skips the task."""
34

35    ui_color = '#e8b7e4'
36

37    def execute(self, context):
38        raise AirflowSkipException
39

40

41def create_test_pipeline(suffix, trigger_rule, dag_):
42    """
43    Instantiate a number of operators for the given DAG.
44

45    :param str suffix: Suffix to append to the operator task_ids
46    :param str trigger_rule: TriggerRule for the join task
47    :param DAG dag_: The DAG to run the operators on
48    """
49    skip_operator = DummySkipOperator(task_id=f'skip_operator_{suffix}', dag=dag_)
50    always_true = DummyOperator(task_id=f'always_true_{suffix}', dag=dag_)
51    join = DummyOperator(task_id=trigger_rule, dag=dag_, trigger_rule=trigger_rule)
52    final = DummyOperator(task_id=f'final_{suffix}', dag=dag_)
53

54    skip_operator >> join
55    always_true >> join
56    join >> final
57

58

59dag = DAG(dag_id='example_skip_dag', default_args=args, start_date=days_ago(2), tags=['example'])
60create_test_pipeline('1', 'all_success', dag)
61create_test_pipeline('2', 'one_success', dag)

50ds_false = [DummyOperator(task_id='false_' + str(i), dag=dag) for i in [1, 2]]
51

item.content:encoded:
example_python_operator

5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file

13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""Example DAG demonstrating the usage of the PythonOperator."""
20import time
21from pprint import pprint
22

23from airflow import DAG
24from airflow.operators.python import PythonOperator, PythonVirtualenvOperator
25from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
26

27args = {
28    'owner': 'airflow',
29}
30

31dag = DAG(
32    dag_id='example_python_operator',
33    default_args=args,
34    schedule_interval=None,
35    start_date=days_ago(2),
36    tags=['example'],
37)
38

39

40# [START howto_operator_python]
41def print_context(ds, **kwargs):
42    """Print the Airflow context and ds variable from the context."""
43    pprint(kwargs)
44    print(ds)
45    return 'Whatever you return gets printed in the logs'
46

47

48run_this = PythonOperator(
49    task_id='print_the_context',
50    python_callable=print_context,
51    dag=dag,
52)
53# [END howto_operator_python]
54

55

56# [START howto_operator_python_kwargs]
57def my_sleeping_function(random_base):
58    """This is a function that will run within the DAG execution"""
59    time.sleep(random_base)
60

61

62# Generate 5 sleeping tasks, sleeping from 0.0 to 0.4 seconds respectively
63for i in range(5):
64    task = PythonOperator(
65        task_id='sleep_for_' + str(i),
66        python_callable=my_sleeping_function,
67        op_kwargs={'random_base': float(i) / 10},
68        dag=dag,
69    )
70

71    run_this >> task
72# [END howto_operator_python_kwargs]
73

74

75# [START howto_operator_python_venv]
76def callable_virtualenv():
77    """
78    Example function that will be performed in a virtual environment.
79

80    Importing at the module level ensures that it will not attempt to import the
81    library before it is installed.
82    """
83    from time import sleep
84

85    from colorama import Back, Fore, Style
86

87    print(Fore.RED + 'some red text')
88    print(Back.GREEN + 'and with a green background')
89    print(Style.DIM + 'and in dim text')
90    print(Style.RESET_ALL)
91    for _ in range(10):
92        print(Style.DIM + 'Please wait...', flush=True)
93        sleep(10)
94    print('Finished')
95

96

97virtualenv_task = PythonVirtualenvOperator(
98    task_id="virtualenv_python",
99    python_callable=callable_virtualenv,
100    requirements=["colorama==0.4.0"],
101    system_site_packages=False,
102    dag=dag,
103)
104# [END howto_operator_python_venv]

item.title: example_kubernetes_executor
item.content:encoded:
example_kubernetes_executor

1#
2# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
3# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
4# distributed with this work for additional information
5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
6# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
7# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
8# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
9#
10#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
11#
12# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18"""
19This is an example dag for using the Kubernetes Executor.
20"""
21import os
22

23from airflow import DAG
24from airflow.example_dags.libs.helper import print_stuff
25from airflow.operators.python import PythonOperator
26from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
27

28args = {
29    'owner': 'airflow',
30}
31

32with DAG(
33    dag_id='example_kubernetes_executor',
34    default_args=args,
35    schedule_interval=None,
36    start_date=days_ago(2),
37    tags=['example', 'example2'],
38) as dag:
39

40    affinity = {
41        'podAntiAffinity': {
42            'requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution': [
43                {
44                    'topologyKey': 'kubernetes.io/hostname',
45                    'labelSelector': {
46                        'matchExpressions': [{'key': 'app', 'operator': 'In', 'values': ['airflow']}]
47                    },
48                }
49            ]
50        }
51    }
52

53    tolerations = [{'key': 'dedicated', 'operator': 'Equal', 'value': 'airflow'}]
54

55    def assert_zip_binary():
56        """
57        Checks whether Zip is installed.
58

59        :raises SystemError: if zip is not installed
60        """
61        return_code = os.system("zip")
62        if return_code != 0:
63            raise SystemError("The zip binary is not found")
64

65    # You don't have to use any special KubernetesExecutor configuration if you don't want to
66    start_task = PythonOperator(task_id="start_task", python_callable=print_stuff)
67

68    # But you can if you want to
69    one_task = PythonOperator(
70        task_id="one_task",
71        python_callable=print_stuff,
72        executor_config={"KubernetesExecutor": {"image": "airflow/ci:latest"}},
73    )
74

75    # Use the zip binary, which is only found in this special docker image
76    two_task = PythonOperator(
77        task_id="two_task",
78        python_callable=assert_zip_binary,
79        executor_config={"KubernetesExecutor": {"image": "airflow/ci_zip:latest"}},
80    )
81

82    # Limit resources on this operator/task with node affinity & tolerations
83    three_task = PythonOperator(
84        task_id="three_task",
85        python_callable=print_stuff,
86        executor_config={
87            "KubernetesExecutor": {
88                "request_memory": "128Mi",
89                "limit_memory": "128Mi",
90                "tolerations": tolerations,
91                "affinity": affinity,
92            }
93        },
94    )
95

96    # Add arbitrary labels to worker pods
97    four_task = PythonOperator(
98        task_id="four_task",
99        python_callable=print_stuff,
100        executor_config={"KubernetesExecutor": {"labels": {"foo": "bar"}}},
101    )
102

103    start_task >> [one_task, two_task, three_task, four_task]

item.title: example_nested_branch_dag
item.content:encoded:
example_nested_branch_dag

1#

3# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
4# distributed with this work for additional information
5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
6# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the

13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""
20Example DAG demonstrating a workflow with nested branching. The join tasks are created with
21``none_failed_or_skipped`` trigger rule such that they are skipped whenever their corresponding
22``BranchPythonOperator`` are skipped.
23"""
24

25from airflow.models import DAG
26from airflow.operators.dummy import DummyOperator
27from airflow.operators.python import BranchPythonOperator
28from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
29

30with DAG(
31    dag_id="example_nested_branch_dag", start_date=days_ago(2), schedule_interval="@daily", tags=["example"]
32) as dag:
33    branch_1 = BranchPythonOperator(task_id="branch_1", python_callable=lambda: "true_1")
34    join_1 = DummyOperator(task_id="join_1", trigger_rule="none_failed_or_skipped")
35    true_1 = DummyOperator(task_id="true_1")
36    false_1 = DummyOperator(task_id="false_1")
37    branch_2 = BranchPythonOperator(task_id="branch_2", python_callable=lambda: "true_2")
38    join_2 = DummyOperator(task_id="join_2", trigger_rule="none_failed_or_skipped")
39    true_2 = DummyOperator(task_id="true_2")
40    false_2 = DummyOperator(task_id="false_2")
41    false_3 = DummyOperator(task_id="false_3")
42

43    branch_1 >> true_1 >> join_1
44    branch_1 >> false_1 >> branch_2 >> [true_2, false_2] >> join_2 >> false_3 >> join_1

item.title: example_dag_decorator
item.content:encoded:
example_dag_decorator

1#
2# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
3# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
4# distributed with this work for additional information
5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
6# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
7# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
8# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
9#
10#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
11#
12# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19

20from typing import Any, Dict
21

22import requests
23

24from airflow.decorators import dag, task
25from airflow.models.baseoperator import BaseOperator
26from airflow.operators.email import EmailOperator
27from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
28

29DEFAULT_ARGS = {"owner": "airflow"}
30

31

32class GetRequestOperator(BaseOperator):
33    """Custom operator to sand GET request to provided url"""
34

35    def __init__(self, *, url: str, **kwargs):
36        super().__init__(**kwargs)
37        self.url = url
38

39    def execute(self, context):
40        return requests.get(self.url).json()
41

42

43# [START dag_decorator_usage]
44@dag(default_args=DEFAULT_ARGS, schedule_interval=None, start_date=days_ago(2), tags=['example'])
45def example_dag_decorator(email: str = 'example@example.com'):
46    """
47    DAG to send server IP to email.
48

49    :param email: Email to send IP to. Defaults to example@example.com.
50    :type email: str
51    """
52    get_ip = GetRequestOperator(task_id='get_ip', url="http://httpbin.org/get")
53

54    @task(multiple_outputs=True)
55    def prepare_email(raw_json: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, str]:
56        external_ip = raw_json['origin']
57        return {
58            'subject': f'Server connected from {external_ip}',
59            'body': f'Seems like today your server executing Airflow is connected from IP {external_ip}<br>',
60        }
61

62    email_info = prepare_email(get_ip.output)
63

64    EmailOperator(
65        task_id='send_email', to=email, subject=email_info['subject'], html_content=email_info['body']
66    )
67

68

69dag = example_dag_decorator()
70# [END dag_decorator_usage]

example_external_task_marker_child

1#

3# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
4# distributed with this work for additional information
5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
6# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
7# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
8# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
9#
10#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
11#
12# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""
20Example DAG demonstrating setting up inter-DAG dependencies using ExternalTaskSensor and
21ExternalTaskMarker
22

23In this example, child_task1 in example_external_task_marker_child depends on parent_task in
24example_external_task_marker_parent. When parent_task is cleared with "Recursive" selected,
25the presence of ExternalTaskMarker tells Airflow to clear child_task1 and its
26downstream tasks.
27

28ExternalTaskSensor will keep poking for the status of remote ExternalTaskMarker task at a regular
29interval till one of the following will happen:
301. ExternalTaskMarker reaches the states mentioned in the allowed_states list
31    In this case, ExternalTaskSensor will exit with a succes status code
322. ExternalTaskMarker reaches the states mentioned in the failed_states list
33    In this case, ExternalTaskSensor will raise an AirflowException and user need to handle this
34    with multiple downstream tasks
353. ExternalTaskSensor times out
36    In this case, ExternalTaskSensor will raise AirflowSkipException or AirflowSensorTimeout
37    exception
38"""
39

40import datetime
41

42from airflow import DAG
43from airflow.operators.dummy import DummyOperator
44from airflow.sensors.external_task import ExternalTaskMarker, ExternalTaskSensor
45

46start_date = datetime.datetime(2015, 1, 1)
47

48with DAG(
49    dag_id="example_external_task_marker_parent",
50    start_date=start_date,
51    schedule_interval=None,
52    tags=['example2'],
53) as parent_dag:
54    # [START howto_operator_external_task_marker]
55    parent_task = ExternalTaskMarker(
56        task_id="parent_task",
57        external_dag_id="example_external_task_marker_child",
58        external_task_id="child_task1",
59    )
60    # [END howto_operator_external_task_marker]
61

62with DAG(
63    dag_id="example_external_task_marker_child",
64    start_date=start_date,
65    schedule_interval=None,
66    tags=['example2'],
67) as child_dag:
68    # [START howto_operator_external_task_sensor]
69    child_task1 = ExternalTaskSensor(
70        task_id="child_task1",
71        external_dag_id=parent_dag.dag_id,
72        external_task_id=parent_task.task_id,
73        timeout=600,
74        allowed_states=['success'],
75        failed_states=['failed', 'skipped'],
76        mode="reschedule",
77    )
78    # [END howto_operator_external_task_sensor]
79    child_task2 = DummyOperator(task_id="child_task2")
80    child_task1 >> child_task2

item.title: example_complex
item.content:encoded:
example_complex

1#
2# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
3# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
4# distributed with this work for additional information
5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
6# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
7# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
8# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
9#
10#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
11#
12# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""
20Example Airflow DAG that shows the complex DAG structure.
21"""
22

23from airflow import models
24from airflow.models.baseoperator import chain
25from airflow.operators.bash import BashOperator
26from airflow.operators.python import PythonOperator
27from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
28

29with models.DAG(
30    dag_id="example_complex",
31    schedule_interval=None,
32    start_date=days_ago(1),
33    tags=['example', 'example2', 'example3'],
34) as dag:
35

36    # Create
37    create_entry_group = BashOperator(task_id="create_entry_group", bash_command="echo create_entry_group")
38

39    create_entry_group_result = BashOperator(
40        task_id="create_entry_group_result", bash_command="echo create_entry_group_result"
41    )
42

43    create_entry_group_result2 = BashOperator(
44        task_id="create_entry_group_result2", bash_command="echo create_entry_group_result2"
45    )
46

47    create_entry_gcs = BashOperator(task_id="create_entry_gcs", bash_command="echo create_entry_gcs")
48

49    create_entry_gcs_result = BashOperator(
50        task_id="create_entry_gcs_result", bash_command="echo create_entry_gcs_result"
51    )
52

53    create_entry_gcs_result2 = BashOperator(
54        task_id="create_entry_gcs_result2", bash_command="echo create_entry_gcs_result2"
55    )
56

57    create_tag = BashOperator(task_id="create_tag", bash_command="echo create_tag")
58

59    create_tag_result = BashOperator(task_id="create_tag_result", bash_command="echo create_tag_result")
60

61    create_tag_result2 = BashOperator(task_id="create_tag_result2", bash_command="echo create_tag_result2")
62

63    create_tag_template = BashOperator(task_id="create_tag_template", bash_command="echo create_tag_template")
64

65    create_tag_template_result = BashOperator(
66        task_id="create_tag_template_result", bash_command="echo create_tag_template_result"
67    )
68

69    create_tag_template_result2 = BashOperator(
70        task_id="create_tag_template_result2", bash_command="echo create_tag_template_result2"
71    )
72

73    create_tag_template_field = BashOperator(
74        task_id="create_tag_template_field", bash_command="echo create_tag_template_field"
75    )
76

77    create_tag_template_field_result = BashOperator(
78        task_id="create_tag_template_field_result", bash_command="echo create_tag_template_field_result"
79    )
80

81    create_tag_template_field_result2 = BashOperator(
82        task_id="create_tag_template_field_result2", bash_command="echo create_tag_template_field_result"
83    )
84

85    # Delete
86    delete_entry = BashOperator(task_id="delete_entry", bash_command="echo delete_entry")
87    create_entry_gcs >> delete_entry
88

89    delete_entry_group = BashOperator(task_id="delete_entry_group", bash_command="echo delete_entry_group")
90    create_entry_group >> delete_entry_group
91

92    delete_tag = BashOperator(task_id="delete_tag", bash_command="echo delete_tag")
93    create_tag >> delete_tag
94

95    delete_tag_template_field = BashOperator(
96        task_id="delete_tag_template_field", bash_command="echo delete_tag_template_field"
97    )
98

99    delete_tag_template = BashOperator(task_id="delete_tag_template", bash_command="echo delete_tag_template")
100

101    # Get
102    get_entry_group = BashOperator(task_id="get_entry_group", bash_command="echo get_entry_group")
103

104    get_entry_group_result = BashOperator(
105        task_id="get_entry_group_result", bash_command="echo get_entry_group_result"
106    )
107

108    get_entry = BashOperator(task_id="get_entry", bash_command="echo get_entry")
109

110    get_entry_result = BashOperator(task_id="get_entry_result", bash_command="echo get_entry_result")
111

112    get_tag_template = BashOperator(task_id="get_tag_template", bash_command="echo get_tag_template")
113

114    get_tag_template_result = BashOperator(
115        task_id="get_tag_template_result", bash_command="echo get_tag_template_result"
116    )
117

118    # List
119    list_tags = BashOperator(task_id="list_tags", bash_command="echo list_tags")
120

121    list_tags_result = BashOperator(task_id="list_tags_result", bash_command="echo list_tags_result")
122

123    # Lookup
124    lookup_entry = BashOperator(task_id="lookup_entry", bash_command="echo lookup_entry")
125

126    lookup_entry_result = BashOperator(task_id="lookup_entry_result", bash_command="echo lookup_entry_result")
127

128    # Rename
129    rename_tag_template_field = BashOperator(
130        task_id="rename_tag_template_field", bash_command="echo rename_tag_template_field"
131    )
132

133    # Search
134    search_catalog = PythonOperator(task_id="search_catalog", python_callable=lambda: print("search_catalog"))
135

136    search_catalog_result = BashOperator(
137        task_id="search_catalog_result", bash_command="echo search_catalog_result"
138    )
139

140    # Update
141    update_entry = BashOperator(task_id="update_entry", bash_command="echo update_entry")
142

143    update_tag = BashOperator(task_id="update_tag", bash_command="echo update_tag")
144

145    update_tag_template = BashOperator(task_id="update_tag_template", bash_command="echo update_tag_template")
146

147    update_tag_template_field = BashOperator(
148        task_id="update_tag_template_field", bash_command="echo update_tag_template_field"
149    )
150

151    # Create
152    create_tasks = [
153        create_entry_group,
154        create_entry_gcs,
155        create_tag_template,
156        create_tag_template_field,
157        create_tag,
158    ]
159    chain(*create_tasks)
160

161    create_entry_group >> delete_entry_group
162    create_entry_group >> create_entry_group_result
163    create_entry_group >> create_entry_group_result2
164

165    create_entry_gcs >> delete_entry
166    create_entry_gcs >> create_entry_gcs_result
167    create_entry_gcs >> create_entry_gcs_result2
168

169    create_tag_template >> delete_tag_template_field
170    create_tag_template >> create_tag_template_result
171    create_tag_template >> create_tag_template_result2
172

173    create_tag_template_field >> delete_tag_template_field
174    create_tag_template_field >> create_tag_template_field_result
175    create_tag_template_field >> create_tag_template_field_result2
176

177    create_tag >> delete_tag
178    create_tag >> create_tag_result
179    create_tag >> create_tag_result2
180

181    # Delete
182    delete_tasks = [
183        delete_tag,
184        delete_tag_template_field,
185        delete_tag_template,
186        delete_entry_group,
187        delete_entry,
188    ]
189    chain(*delete_tasks)
190

191    # Get
192    create_tag_template >> get_tag_template >> delete_tag_template
193    get_tag_template >> get_tag_template_result
194

195    create_entry_gcs >> get_entry >> delete_entry
196    get_entry >> get_entry_result
197

198    create_entry_group >> get_entry_group >> delete_entry_group
199    get_entry_group >> get_entry_group_result
200

201    # List
202    create_tag >> list_tags >> delete_tag
203    list_tags >> list_tags_result
204

205    # Lookup
206    create_entry_gcs >> lookup_entry >> delete_entry
207    lookup_entry >> lookup_entry_result
208

209    # Rename
210    create_tag_template_field >> rename_tag_template_field >> delete_tag_template_field
211

212    # Search
213    chain(create_tasks, search_catalog, delete_tasks)
214    search_catalog >> search_catalog_result
215

216    # Update
217    create_entry_gcs >> update_entry >> delete_entry
218    create_tag >> update_tag >> delete_tag
219    create_tag_template >> update_tag_template >> delete_tag_template
220    create_tag_template_field >> update_tag_template_field >> rename_tag_template_field

19"""
20Example DAG demonstrating setting up inter-DAG dependencies using ExternalTaskSensor and
21ExternalTaskMarker
22

23In this example, child_task1 in example_external_task_marker_child depends on parent_task in
24example_external_task_marker_parent. When parent_task is cleared with "Recursive" selected,
25the presence of ExternalTaskMarker tells Airflow to clear child_task1 and its
26downstream tasks.
27

28ExternalTaskSensor will keep poking for the status of remote ExternalTaskMarker task at a regular
29interval till one of the following will happen:
301. ExternalTaskMarker reaches the states mentioned in the allowed_states list
31    In this case, ExternalTaskSensor will exit with a succes status code
322. ExternalTaskMarker reaches the states mentioned in the failed_states list
33    In this case, ExternalTaskSensor will raise an AirflowException and user need to handle this
34    with multiple downstream tasks
353. ExternalTaskSensor times out
36    In this case, ExternalTaskSensor will raise AirflowSkipException or AirflowSensorTimeout
37    exception
38"""
39

40import datetime
41

42from airflow import DAG
43from airflow.operators.dummy import DummyOperator
44from airflow.sensors.external_task import ExternalTaskMarker, ExternalTaskSensor
45

46start_date = datetime.datetime(2015, 1, 1)
47

48with DAG(
49    dag_id="example_external_task_marker_parent",
50    start_date=start_date,
51    schedule_interval=None,
52    tags=['example2'],
53) as parent_dag:
54    # [START howto_operator_external_task_marker]

56        task_id="parent_task",
57        external_dag_id="example_external_task_marker_child",
58        external_task_id="child_task1",

60    # [END howto_operator_external_task_marker]

62with DAG(

70        task_id="child_task1",
71        external_dag_id=parent_dag.dag_id,
72        external_task_id=parent_task.task_id,
73        timeout=600,
74        allowed_states=['success'],
75        failed_states=['failed', 'skipped'],

item.title: example_passing_params_via_test_command
item.content:encoded:
example_passing_params_via_test_command

1#
2# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
3# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
4# distributed with this work for additional information
5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
6# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
7# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
8# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
9#
10#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
11#
12# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""Example DAG demonstrating the usage of the params arguments in templated arguments."""
20

21import os
22from datetime import timedelta
23

24from airflow import DAG
25from airflow.operators.bash import BashOperator
26from airflow.operators.python import PythonOperator
27from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
28

29dag = DAG(
30    "example_passing_params_via_test_command",
31    default_args={
32        "owner": "airflow",
33    },
34    schedule_interval='*/1 * * * *',
35    start_date=days_ago(1),
36    dagrun_timeout=timedelta(minutes=4),
37    tags=['example'],
38)
39

40

41def my_py_command(test_mode, params):
42    """
43    Print out the "foo" param passed in via
44    `airflow tasks test example_passing_params_via_test_command run_this <date>
45    -t '{"foo":"bar"}'`
46    """
47    if test_mode:
48        print(
49            " 'foo' was passed in via test={} command : kwargs[params][foo] \
50               = {}".format(
51                test_mode, params["foo"]
52            )
53        )
54    # Print out the value of "miff", passed in below via the Python Operator
55    print(" 'miff' was passed in via task params = {}".format(params["miff"]))
56    return 1
57

58

59my_templated_command = """
60    echo " 'foo was passed in via Airflow CLI Test command with value {{ params.foo }} "
61    echo " 'miff was passed in via BashOperator with value {{ params.miff }} "
62"""
63

64run_this = PythonOperator(
65    task_id='run_this',
66    python_callable=my_py_command,
67    params={"miff": "agg"},
68    dag=dag,
69)
70

71also_run_this = BashOperator(
72    task_id='also_run_this',
73    bash_command=my_templated_command,
74    params={"miff": "agg"},
75    dag=dag,
76)
77

78

79def print_env_vars(test_mode):
80    """
81    Print out the "foo" param passed in via
82    `airflow tasks test example_passing_params_via_test_command env_var_test_task <date>
83    --env-vars '{"foo":"bar"}'`
84    """
85    if test_mode:
86        print("foo={}".format(os.environ.get('foo')))
87        print("AIRFLOW_TEST_MODE={}".format(os.environ.get('AIRFLOW_TEST_MODE')))
88

89

90env_var_test_task = PythonOperator(task_id='env_var_test_task', python_callable=print_env_vars, dag=dag)
91

92run_this >> also_run_this

item.content:encoded:
example_branch_operator

1#

16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""Example DAG demonstrating the usage of the BranchPythonOperator."""
20

21import random
22

23from airflow import DAG
24from airflow.operators.dummy import DummyOperator
25from airflow.operators.python import BranchPythonOperator
26from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
27

28args = {
29    'owner': 'airflow',
30}
31

32dag = DAG(
33    dag_id='example_branch_operator',
34    default_args=args,
35    start_date=days_ago(2),
36    schedule_interval="@daily",
37    tags=['example', 'example2'],
38)
39

40run_this_first = DummyOperator(
41    task_id='run_this_first',
42    dag=dag,
43)
44

45options = ['branch_a', 'branch_b', 'branch_c', 'branch_d']
46

47branching = BranchPythonOperator(
48    task_id='branching',
49    python_callable=lambda: random.choice(options),
50    dag=dag,
51)
52run_this_first >> branching
53

54join = DummyOperator(
55    task_id='join',
56    trigger_rule='none_failed_or_skipped',
57    dag=dag,
58)
59

60for option in options:
61    t = DummyOperator(
62        task_id=option,
63        dag=dag,
64    )
65

66    dummy_follow = DummyOperator(
67        task_id='follow_' + option,
68        dag=dag,
69    )
70

71    branching >> t >> dummy_follow >> join

item.title: example_branch_dop_operator_v3
item.content:encoded:
example_branch_dop_operator_v3

1#

4# distributed with this work for additional information
5# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file

13# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
14# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""
20Example DAG demonstrating the usage of BranchPythonOperator with depends_on_past=True, where tasks may be run
21or skipped on alternating runs.
22"""
23

24from airflow import DAG
25from airflow.operators.dummy import DummyOperator
26from airflow.operators.python import BranchPythonOperator
27from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
28

29args = {
30    'owner': 'airflow',
31    'depends_on_past': True,
32}
33

34dag = DAG(
35    dag_id='example_branch_dop_operator_v3',
36    schedule_interval='*/1 * * * *',
37    start_date=days_ago(2),
38    default_args=args,
39    tags=['example'],
40)
41

42

43def should_run(**kwargs):
44    """
45    Determine which dummy_task should be run based on if the execution date minute is even or odd.
46

47    :param dict kwargs: Context
48    :return: Id of the task to run
49    :rtype: str
50    """
51    print(
52        '------------- exec dttm = {} and minute = {}'.format(
53            kwargs['execution_date'], kwargs['execution_date'].minute
54        )
55    )
56    if kwargs['execution_date'].minute % 2 == 0:
57        return "dummy_task_1"
58    else:
59        return "dummy_task_2"
60

61

62cond = BranchPythonOperator(
63    task_id='condition',
64    python_callable=should_run,
65    dag=dag,
66)
67

68dummy_task_1 = DummyOperator(task_id='dummy_task_1', dag=dag)
69dummy_task_2 = DummyOperator(task_id='dummy_task_2', dag=dag)
70cond >> [dummy_task_1, dummy_task_2]

item.content:encoded:
example_bash_operator

15# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
16# specific language governing permissions and limitations
17# under the License.
18

19"""Example DAG demonstrating the usage of the BashOperator."""
20

21from datetime import timedelta
22

23from airflow import DAG
24from airflow.operators.bash import BashOperator
25from airflow.operators.dummy import DummyOperator
26from airflow.utils.dates import days_ago
27

28args = {
29    'owner': 'airflow',
30}
31

32dag = DAG(
33    dag_id='example_bash_operator',
34    default_args=args,
35    schedule_interval='0 0 * * *',
36    start_date=days_ago(2),
37    dagrun_timeout=timedelta(minutes=60),
38    tags=['example', 'example2'],
39    params={"example_key": "example_value"},
40)
41

42run_this_last = DummyOperator(
43    task_id='run_this_last',
44    dag=dag,
45)
46

47# [START howto_operator_bash]
48run_this = BashOperator(
49    task_id='run_after_loop',
50    bash_command='echo 1',
51    dag=dag,
52)
53# [END howto_operator_bash]
54

55run_this >> run_this_last
56

57for i in range(3):
58    task = BashOperator(
59        task_id='runme_' + str(i),
60        bash_command='echo "{{ task_instance_key_str }}" && sleep 1',
61        dag=dag,
62    )
63    task >> run_this
64

65# [START howto_operator_bash_template]
66also_run_this = BashOperator(
67    task_id='also_run_this',
68    bash_command='echo "run_id={{ run_id }} | dag_run={{ dag_run }}"',
69    dag=dag,
70)

72also_run_this >> run_this_last
73

74if __name__ == "__main__":
75    dag.cli()
